definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: He said Washington "will not provide a blank check."
sentences.chinese: 他说，华盛顿“不会给他们一张空白支票”。

sentences.english: We have signed a blank cheque on the public purse.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经签了一张国库的空白支票。

sentences.english: B. Is the countersigning of checks in advance prohibited?
sentences.chinese: 是否禁止连署签发空白支票？

sentences.english: And that was a blank check.
sentences.chinese: 而且华尔街得到的还是张空白支票。

sentences.english: And after years of mixed results, we will not provide a blank check.
sentences.chinese: 经过若干年的反复努力之后，我们不会提供空白支票。

sentences.english: He says no longer will contractors be given "a blank check."
sentences.chinese: 他表示，再也不能给承包商发放空白支票了。

sentences.english: Congress would be abdicating its responsibility if it gave the Treasury secretary a blank cheque.
sentences.chinese: 如果给财政部长开出“空白支票”，国会就是在失职。
